thread.title: Police: Officer shoots dog attacking people, bystander hit
thread.title_full: Police: Officer shoots dog attacking people, bystander hit | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Associated Press
title: Police: Officer shoots dog attacking people, bystander hit
text:
PHOENIX — Phoenix police say an officer accidentally wounded a bystander while shooting a dog that had been attacking the officer and other people.
Sgt. Jonathan Howard said the incident occurred Thursday morning outside a convenience store after a person entered the store and told the officer that the dog was attacking people outside.
Howard said officer went outside to assist and was attacked by the dog.
According to Howard, the officer then shot the dog but one of his shots hit a person in the area.
Howard said the person was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries that aren’t life threatening injuries, while the officer’s bite injuries also are not life-threatening..
Howard said animal control removed the dog, which later died. Police continue to investigate the incident.
